doc.after: Oklahoma is the nation's third-largest producer of natural gas, fifth-largest producer of crude oil, and has the second-greatest number of active drilling rigs,[107][113] and ranks fifth in crude oil reserves.[114] While the state ranked eighth for installed wind energy capacity in 2011,[115] it is at the bottom of states in usage of renewable energy, with 94 percent of its electricity being generated by non-renewable sources in 2009, including 25 percent from coal and 46 percent from natural gas.[116] Ranking 13th for total energy consumption per capita in 2009,[117] Oklahoma's energy costs were 8th lowest in the nation.[118]
